MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Alan Turing | b: Donald Hebb | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Tom M. Mitchell

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cybernet | b: Cybertron | c: Cyberdyne | d: Skynet

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, what is the definition of machine learning algorithms?
Choices: a: A computer program that can think independently | b: A computer program that learns from experience to improve performance | c: A computer program that mimics human cognitive processes | d: A computer program that predicts future outcomes without training

MCQ: What is one of the objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To confuse data based on models | b: To make predictions for past outcomes | c: To classify data based on models | d: To ignore data and make random predictions

MCQ: Which researcher proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks for machine learning algorithms?
Choices: a: Walter Pitts | b: Warren McCulloch | c: Donald Hebb | d: Tom M. Mitchell
